revised_title: Applications of Dynamical Principles to Chemical and Physical Phenomena
tldr: This paper explores the application of dynamical principles to various physical and chemical phenomena, such as evaporation, liquefaction, dissociation, chemical combination, and heat conduction. The author demonstrates alternative methods to using the Second Law of Thermodynamics to solve problems in these areas and discusses the effects of external factors like pressure, capillarity, and temperature on these processes.
